sentence.text: Canine antigen receptor-mediated signaling pathway cell tumours (CMCT) are one of the most common skin tumours in dogs with a major negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II on canine health.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Certain breeds have a higher risk of developing antigen receptor-mediated signaling pathway cell tumours, suggesting that underlying predisposing germ-line genetic factors play a role in the development of this disease.
